item.title: Stoping ncp killing :(
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

[code]break;

case 131: //Magic on NPCs
int npcIndex = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndianA();
int magicID = inStream.readSignedWordA();
println_debug("npcIndex: “+npcIndex+” magicID: "+magicID);
//setAnimation(711);
int EnemyX2 = server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].absX;
int EnemyY2 = server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].absY;
int EnemyHP2 = server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].HP;
if(EnemyX2 != absX && EnemyY2 != absY)
faceNPC(npcIndex);

            boolean Cant = false;

            if(server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].attacknpc > 0) {
            Cant = true;
            sendMessage("You can't attack a dueling npc!");
            }
            [/code]

watever it goes faster then you think it works tho.

if (type.hp = 0) {

}

i dont know if thats the right format for your server but it works for me just make the npc’s Health z3r0.

item.title: Stoping ncp killing :(
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“Killer-99-pkz, post:3, topic:195429”]go to your packet 131 and put this in there…

if (type == unattack()) {
break;
}

Now put this after public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

public static int unattack[] = { /PUT YOUR NPC’S THAT YOU DONT WANT ATTACKED IN HERE/ };
public static int unattack() {
return unattack[(int) (Math.random() * unattack.length)];
}

There you Go

  • Killer 99[/quote]

That works randomly. So sometimes you can attack it, sometimes you can’t. You’d probably want to do something like this:

for(int i = 0; i < unattack.length; i++) {
    if(unattack[i] == type) break;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Stoping ncp killing :(
item.dc:creator: @Killer-99-pkz Killer-99-pkz
item.description:
@Killer-99-pkz wrote:

go to your packet 131 and put this in there…

if (type == unattack()) {
break;
}

Now put this after public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

public static int unattack[] = { /PUT YOUR NPC’S THAT YOU DONT WANT ATTACKED IN HERE/ };
public static int unattack() {
return unattack[(int) (Math.random() * unattack.length)];
}

There you Go

  • Killer 99
